The shooter, identified as 15-year-old Keith Elliott, was charged as an adult with gun violations, armed burglary and assault.

properties.title: Sullivan Central High
properties.description: Thomas Cowan entered Sullivan Central High School with two loaded guns with the intent on killing principal Melanie Riden. SRO Carolyn Gudger was able to hold him off until back-up arrived, when they were forced to shoot and kill Cowan. No staff or students were injured.

properties.title: Alisal High
properties.description: 15-year-old student Jose Cisneros was shot to death on an athletic field at Alisal High School, as he was walking to school. Police said that the shooting was gang-related.

properties.title: Marinette High
properties.description: Samuel Hengel took 23 students and one teacher hostage for over 5 hours at Marinette High School after firing shots at a projector. The suspect, a student in the sophomore Western Civilization class, shot himself after police officers stormed the classroom shortly after 8 p.m. All hostages were removed safely.

properties.title: Millard South High
properties.description: Student Robert Butler Jr., 18, shot and killed Assistant Principal Dr. Vicki Kaspar, and wounded Principal Curtis Case. Butler then opened fire indiscriminately in the front office area, causing the school nurse to be injured by gunshot debris. Butler drove to a parking lot and then fatally shot himself.

properties.title: Gardena High
properties.description: Two students were wounded when a gun brought to Gardena High School by a student accidentally discharged when the backpack containing the firearm was dropped on the ground, with a single bullet wounding both victims. One student was shot in the head and was reported to be in critical condition. The student who brought the gun to school was arrested.

properties.title: Martinsville West Middle
properties.description: Michael Phelps, a 15-year-old suspended student, returned to Martinsville West Middle School with a 9mm handgun. In the entrance of the school, Phelps encountered 15-year-old Chance Jackson and shot him twice in the abdomen. Phelps fled the school and dropped the handgun in a field and was arrested shortly after.

properties.title: Worthing High
properties.description: An 18-year-old man died and five other people were injured when two people opened fire during a football game at Worthing High School in Houston. Police suspected that the shooting was gang-related.

properties.title: Hine Jr High
properties.description: Tyrone Perry, 15, was shot to death at Hine Junior High School.

properties.title: Armstrong High
properties.description: Wayne Phillips, 17, was shot to death when he was caught between two youths who were fighting in the hallway of Armstrong High School.

properties.title: Elmwood Park Comm High
properties.description: Elmwood Park Community High School student Cynthia Schulze was shot and killed in the hallway between classes by student William Rossi, with whom she was probably not acquainted. Rossi then ran out of the school and shot himself to death in an alley nearby.

properties.title: Brownstown Central High
properties.description: Jessie Blevins, 48, athletic director at Brownstown Central High School, was shot to death in the school parking lot by a 17-year-old student.

properties.title: Olean High
properties.description: 17-year-old Anthony F. Barbaro, an honor student and member of the school's rifle team, indiscriminately shot at people on the street from windows at the third floor of the school building. Three people were killed and another 11 people were injured during the shooting.

properties.title: U.S. Grant High
properties.description: U.S. Grant High School student Randy Truitt was shot and killed by James Briggs at the school, leaving several others injured.[147]

properties.title: Murray-Wright High
properties.description: Intruders shot five Murray-Wright High School students after an apparent dispute over one of the intruders girlfriends.

properties.title: Whitharral High
properties.description: High School principal M. O. Tripp was shot to death on the front steps of the school by Ricardo Lopez, 17.

properties.title: Hayes Jr High
properties.description: A 15-year-old student was shot and killed by another student at Hayes Junior High School.

properties.title: Murchison Middle School
properties.description: John Daniel Christian, 13, son of Lyndon B. Johnson's former press secretary George Christian, shot to death his English teacher, Wilbur Grayson, 29, with his father's .22 caliber rifle in front of approximately 30 classmates. John Christian was arrested and charged but was not prosecuted. He spent two years in a mental hospital. He is now a practicing attorney in Austin, Texas.

properties.title: Valley High
properties.description: 17-year-old Valley High School student Patrick Lizotte shot and killed his teacher Clarence Pigott and wounded two students.

properties.title: Wingfield High
properties.description: Faye Williams, 17, was shot to death in her algebra classroom at Wingfield High School by her ex-boyfriend, James Hartzog, 18. Hartzog then killed himself.

properties.title: Southeast Polk High
properties.description: While students in a French class at Southeast Polk High School were taking a test in the hallway, a 17-year-old male student shot and killed a 16-year-old female student before killing himself.

properties.title: Goddard Jr High
properties.description: James Alan Kearbey, 14, armed with a M1-A semiautomatic rifle and a .357-caliber handgun, killed principal Joseph McGee and wounded two teachers and a student at Goddard Junior High School.

properties.title: East End Middle
properties.description: A 12-year-old East End Middle School boy shot a girl with his mother's gun.

properties.title: Northwestern High
properties.description: During halftime of the homecoming football game between Northwestern High School and Murray-Wright High School, a boy who was in a fight earlier that day pulled out a shotgun and opened fire, injuring six students.

properties.title: Boyet Jr High
properties.description: 13-year-old gifted Boyet Junior High School student Matt Cooper shot himself in class with a .45-caliber pistol.

properties.title: Murray Wright High
properties.description: A ninth-grade Murray Wright High School student killed Chester Jackson, 17, and wounded Damon Matthews, 17, and Tomeka Turner, 18.

properties.title: Mayde Creek High
properties.description: Mayde Creek High School student Ramesh D. Tumalad, 15, shot himself to death in his Algebra class as his classmates looked on.

properties.title: Bunche Middle
properties.description: A teenager aimed and fired a handgun at a security guard who had chased him and three friends off the grounds of Ralph J. Bunche Middle School. However, instead of hitting his intended target, the bullet struck 11-year-old bystander Alejandro Vargas, a student at the school, killing him.

properties.title: Douglass High
properties.description: A 14 year-old student shot a 17 year-old student to death in a Douglass High School hallway, prompting the installation of metal detectors in city schools.

properties.title: Lindhurst High
properties.description: Armed with a pistol, 20-year-old Eric Houston took hostages at his former high school, killing four people and wounding 10. His motive was his inability to find a good job because he had failed a grade at school. He was given the death penalty for the shooting.

properties.title: East Carter High
properties.description: Scott Pennington, 17, fatally shot his teacher, Deanna McDavid, and head custodian Marvin Hicks at East Carter High School.

properties.title: Chelsea High
properties.description: High school teacher Steven Leith walked out of a staff meeting, returned with a gun, fatally shot the school district's superintendent and wounded the principal and a teacher.

properties.title: Wickliffe Middle
properties.description: Keith Ledeger, 37, a former student at Wickliffe Middle School, shot and killed custodian Pete Christopher and wounded four other adults.

properties.title: Garfield High
properties.description: A 15-year-old Garfield High School student left school during the day and returned with his grandfather's 9mm semiautomatic handgun. He wounded two students.

properties.title: Blackville-Hilda High
properties.description: Anthony Sincino, 16, killed one teacher and wounded another at Blackville-Hilda High School before committing suicide.

properties.title: Richland High
properties.description: James Rouse, 17, killed a student and teacher and seriously wounded another teacher at Richland High School with a .22 caliber rifle.

properties.title: Frontier Middle
properties.description: Barry Loukaitis, 14, killed a teacher and two students and wounded another student at Frontier Middle School when he opened fire on his algebra class. Loukaitis was sentenced to life in prison.

properties.title: Mid-Peninsula High
properties.description: Douglas Bradley, a 16-year-old with a history of depression, drove on to the playground at Mid-Peninsula High School and began throwing money out the window to draw the attention of his classmates. As students drew close to pick up the money, Douglas opened fire with a .38-caliber handgun. He fired three shots and wounded a 14-year-old boy in the leg. With a fourth shot, Douglas committed suicide.

properties.title: Pearl High
properties.description: Luke Woodham, 16, murdered his mother at home before killing his ex-girlfriend and another student and wounding seven others at Pearl High School. The perpetrator attempted to flee police and continue his killing spree at a nearby middle school, but he was stopped and detained by the Vice Principal.

properties.title: Heath High
properties.description: Three students were killed and five wounded by Michael Carneal, 14, as they participated in a prayer circle. Carneal was sentenced to life in prison.

properties.title: Parker Middle
properties.description: Andrew Wurst, 14, fatally shot teacher John Gillette, 48, and wounded two students and a teacher at a Parker Middle School 8th grade graduation dance.

properties.title: Thurston High
properties.description: After killing his parents at home, Kip Kinkel, 15, drove to Thurston High School where he shot and killed two students and wounded 25 others. He was sentenced to 111 years of prison.

properties.title: Armstrong High
properties.description: A 14-year-old student of Armstrong High School wounded a teacher and a school volunteer.

properties.title: Notus Jr. Sr. High
properties.description: Shawn Cooper, 15, fired two shots from a 12 gauge shotgun, in the hall near the front desk at Notus Jr. Sr. High School. There were no serious injuries, but some students were close enough to the blast to catch some shrapnel from the tile floor. Shawn Cooper had been undergoing treatment for bipolar disorder.

properties.title: Heritage High
properties.description: Six students from Heritage High School were shot and injured by student Thomas

Solomon Jr., 15. A 15-year-old girl was hospitalized in critical condition, and the other victims suffered from non-life threatening injuries. Solomon initially faced up to 351 years of prison if convicted of aggravated assault and other charges, but in 2000 he was found guilty but mentally ill and was sentenced to 40 years in prison and 65 years of probation.

properties.title: Lynwood High
properties.description: 15-year-old Jessica Yvette Zavala and her 17-year-old cousin, Olivia Munguia, were shot by an unknown assailant outside Lynwood High School.

properties.title: Deming Middle
properties.description: A 13-year-old girl fatally shot at Deming Middle School by Victor Cordova Jr., 13. Cordova stated he had intended to commit suicide but was jostled by others and the gun moved.

properties.title: Santana High
properties.description: Armed with a .22-caliber revolver, 15-year-old Charles Andrew Williams opened fire in a male toilet facility at Santana High School in Santee, California, killing one student. Then exiting the restroom, Williams fired indiscriminately at nearby students, killing another student and wounding 13. Shortly afterward he retreated back into the restroom, where he surrendered to police. In June 2002, Williams was sentenced to 50 years in prison.

properties.title: Bishop Neumann High
properties.description: Elizabeth Catherine Bush, 14, wounded student Kimberly Marchese in the cafeteria of Bishop Neumann High School; she was depressed and frequently teased.

properties.title: Granite Hills High
properties.description: Jason Hoffman opened fire at Granite Hills High School, El Cajon, CA injuring five people. Hoffman committed suicide in prison in 2002.

properties.title: McDonogh High
properties.description: Two men killed 15-year-old student Jonathan
Williams at John McDonogh High School.

properties.title: Red Lion Area Jr High
properties.description: On April 24, 2003, eighth-grade student James Sheets entered Red Lion Area Junior High School armed with his stepfather's pistols and subsequently killed the school's principal, Eugene Segro, before killing himself.

properties.title: Rocori High
properties.description: 15-year-old Jason McLaughlin shot Aaron Rollins and Seth Bartell at Rocori High School with a .22- caliber pistol. Rollins died the same day; Bartell died October 10 of injuries sustained in the attack

properties.title: Harlan Comm Academy High
properties.description: At Harlan Community Academy High School, a fight broke between two 15-year-old boys in the gymnasium. One of the boys took out a .25-caliber pistol and shot the other one in the leg. A police officer on duty at the school arrested the gunman.

properties.title: Roseburg High
properties.description: 14-year-old Vincent Leodoro shot 16-year-old fellow student Joseph Monti in the back four times with a 10mm semi-automatic pistol, critically injuring him, in the courtyard of Roseburg High School in Roseburg, Oregon.

properties.title: Pine Middle
properties.description: 14-year-old student James Newman brought a .38-caliber revolver to Pine Middle School in Reno, Nevada, and shot and injured two students at random in the school's hallway before being restrained by a physical education teacher.

properties.title: Platte Canyon High
properties.description: Platte Canyon High School hostage crisis: Duane Roger Morrison walked into Platte Canyon High School and took six girls hostages and sexually assaulted them. As police entered the classroom he killed one hostage and then shot himself.

properties.title: Henry Foss High
properties.description: 18-year-old Douglas S. Chanthabouly shot 17-year-old Samnang Kok to death in the Henry Foss High School hallways due to a personal disagreement. Chathabouly was found guilty of second-degree murder and was sentenced to 23 years of prison.

properties.title: Crook County High
properties.description: An 18-year-old male student at Crook County High School died of a gunshot wound to the head in an apparent suicide in the school's parking lot.

properties.title: Manassas High
properties.description: A Manassas High School student was accidentally shot in the arm by a friend during an honors English class when the friend's gun went off in his coat pocket. The student was treated and released.

properties.title: Mitchell High
properties.description: A 15-year-old Hamilton High School student shot an algebra classmate in the leg during an argument over rap music. The injured student recovered.

properties.title: Mitchell High
properties.description: A 19-year-old senior was shot in his school's gym by a 17-year-old sophomore, following a feud that started off campus earlier in the week; after the shooting, the suspect hands his gun to a coach, saying,

properties.title: E.O. Green Jr High
properties.description: 15-year-old Lawrence Fobes King was shot in the head twice by 14-year-old classmate Brandon McInerney in the E.O. Green Junior High School computer lab in Oxnard, California.

properties.title: Lakota High
properties.description: 26-year-old Omero Mendez was sitting in his car parked on the Lakota Middle School campus to wait to pick up his girlfriend's son. There, he was confronted by 16-year-old Luis F. Cosgaya-Alvarez and two of his friends who were inside an SUV. Cosgaya-Alvarez flashed gang signs at Mendez, and then shot Mendez once in the head. Mendez later died of his injuries. Cosgaya-Alvarez was arrested a few days later in Seattle and was charged with murder.

properties.title: Central High
properties.description: On August 21, 2008, 15-year-old student Jamar Siler entered the school cafeteria and approached student Ryan McDonald sitting at a lunch table. Siler fatally shot McDonald, and was shortly after arrested by authorities. The two had been in previous altercations, the details of which were not released to the general public. Siler was then taken into custody.

properties.title: Henry Ford High
properties.description: Christopher Walker, 16, was killed, and three other teenagers were seriously wounded during a drive-by shooting at a primary school lawn adjacent to Henry Ford High School, where Walker and the other students were just dismissed from after classes ended.

properties.title: Dunbar High
properties.description: Five male teenagers leaving a basketball game held on the campus of Dunbar Vocational Career Academy, in the South Side area of Chicago, Illinois, received gunshot wounds after shots were fired from a passing vehicle. All five victims were sent to Chicago area hospitals, three of whom were treated for serious injuries. Police arrested 18-year-old Georgio Dukes a week after the shooting on five counts of aggravated battery with a firearm.

properties.title: Larose-Cut Off Middle
properties.description: Justin Doucet, a 15-year-old eighth grade student, fired one shot from a .25-caliber semi-automatic pistol above a teacher's head inside her classroom at Larose-Cut Off Middle School, in Larose, Louisiana, and then entered a restroom next door and shot himself through the chin.

properties.title: Deer Creek Middle
properties.description: A 32-year-old gunman, identified as Bruco Strongeagle Eastwood, opened fire on students at Deer Creek Middle School at 3:30 pm (MST) as school was being let out in Littleton, Colorado. The gunman was later tackled by a math teacher and the teacher turned him into the police when they arrived on scene. The gunman shot and injured two students at the school before he was taken into custody.

properties.title: Mumford High
properties.description: Two students were shot and wounded in front of Mumford High School. A 17-year-old man, Steven Jamal Hare, was tried as an adult and charged with assault with intent to kill.

properties.title: Topeka West High
properties.description: 20-year-old Matthew C. Mitchell was shot to death on the grounds of Topeka West High School during a drug deal. A 17-year-old male was injured from five gunshot wounds. Police arrested three suspects.

properties.title: Aurora Central High
properties.description: In a gang-related attack outside Aurora Central High School, a 17-year-old girl was shot and wounded. The wounds caused her to be paralyzed. Luis Enrique Guzman-Rincon, 20, fired shots from a car while students were standing outside the high school, trying to shoot at a group of students who were believed to be gang rivals.

properties.title: Highlands Intermediate
properties.description: A 14-year-old student is accused of firing a handgun on the campus of Highlands Intermediate School, wounding one student. The gunman was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder. Two other suspects were arrested in connection with the shooting.

properties.title: Cape Fear High
properties.description: A 15-year-old girl was shot in the neck at Cape Fear High School. A .22-caliber rifle was used in the attack. A student of the school,15-year-old Charles Underwood, was arrested and charged with attempted murder.

properties.title: North Forest High
properties.description: One student was shot and injured after another student opened fire at North Forest High School. The student said that he was being confronted by three other students who were bullying him, and he took out a handgun and fired at them in self-defense. A 16-year-old bystander was unintentionally hit in the leg. The 18-year-old suspect was charged with aggravated assault with a deadly weapon.

properties.title: Chardon High
properties.description: Six students were shot at Chardon High School. One student, Daniel Parmentor, died at the scene, and on February 28, two other students, Russell King and Demetrius Hewlin, also died. The shooter, Thomas
Lane, was taken into police custody.

properties.title: Hamilton High
properties.description: Two Hamilton High School students were shot and wounded in the parking lot of the school. The attack was believed to be gang-related.

properties.title: Perry Hall High
properties.description: Robert Gladden, 15, took a double barrel shotgun to Perry Hall High School and fired shots inside the school cafeteria. A 17-year-old senior was hit in the lower back while he was sitting at a table and suffered critical wounds. Gladden was immediately subdued by two school faculty members, and was arrested.

properties.title: Normal Comm High
properties.description: A student fired multiple gunshots in the ceiling of Normal Community High School, and was tackled by a teacher. Nobody was injured. A 14-year-old student was arrested and is charged with 16 felony counts.

properties.title: Stillwater Jr High
properties.description: Cade Poulos, 13, fataly shot himself in the head shortly before classes started at Stillwater Junior High School.

properties.title: Fairmount High
properties.description: A freshman of Fairmount Public School shot himself in the head with a handgun in front of his classmates in a classroom.

properties.title: Taft Union High
properties.description: 16-year-old student, Bryan Oliver entered a science classroom of Taft Union High School with a 12 gauge shotgun and opened fire. A 16-year-old male student, identified as Bowe Cleveland, was shot in the chest and critically wounded. Another student was shot at, but was not hit. The classroom teacher, Ryan Heber, convinced him to drop his weapon, and the gunman followed his order and was later arrested.

properties.title: Osborn High
properties.description: A 16-year-old boy was shot in a field across the school campus after a basketball game was held at Osborn High School. He was hospitalized in serious condition.

properties.title: Price Middle
properties.description: A 14-year-old male student was shot and wounded in the back of the neck at Price Middle School. The gunman, a student, was believed to be arguing with the other student before taking out a handgun and firing multiple shots at him. In addition, a teacher was injured during the shooting. Afterward, the gunman was disarmed by a school resource officer and subsequently apprehended. He was charged with aggravated assault.

properties.title: La Salle High
properties.description: A student shot himself at La Salle High School, a Catholic school. The student, Joe Poynter, was hospitalized in critical condition at a Cincinnati hospital. According to police, no known threats were made to any other students or staff. Police arrived immediately after the incident was reported.

properties.title: Carver High
properties.description: A 15-year-old student was shot in the neck and shoulder at Carver High School. The victim was hospitalized with non-life threatening injuries. An 18-year-old student was apprehended by a school resource officer without incident.

properties.title: Cook County High
properties.description: 17-year-old David Riehm was arrested at his home after authorities at Cook County High School turned over a collection of writings and essays to police in which Riehm described in great detail shooting and killing his English teacher. He was later acquitted of all charges.

properties.title: Penn High
properties.description: 16-year old Russell Frantom was arrested after notebook retrieved from his locker at Penn High School stated
He and a 33 year old possible accomplice, Lee Billi, were charged with conspiracy. Lee Billi was sentenced to 10 years in prison on March 26, 2009

properties.title: Pottstown High
properties.description: 15-year-old Richard Yanis was arrested for plotting a school shooting at Pottstown High School after his father reported to police three missing handguns. An investigation revealed that Yanis had stolen the guns from his father and put them into a duffel bag, which he handed to a friend with the words to
. After checking the bag Yanis' friend told his mother of the weapons, who then forced him to get rid of them by throwing them into a river.

properties.title: Malcolm High
properties.description: 17-year-old Joshua Magee was arrested in the parking lot of Malcolm High School after a school staff member, who saw the youth drinking liquor and putting on a black overcoat, called police. A search of Magee's car produced a bolt-action rifle, 20 bombs and a note stating that he wanted to injure everyone at the school except for three friends. Magee, to whom the school paid close attention after it was reported to faculty that he was experimenting with explosives at home, was charged with attempted murder.

properties.title: Green Bay East High
properties.description: Two 17-year-old boys were arrested the morning of Sept. 14 at Green Bay East High School for allegedly planning an armed attack on their school.

properties.title: Plymouth Whitemarsh High
properties.description: 14-year-old Dillon Cossey was arrested at his home in Plymouth Meeting after a friend told police about his plan to carry out a Columbine style attack on Plymouth Whitemarsh High School.

properties.title: Univ of Washington
properties.description: Justin M. Jasper was arrested by University of Washington police after being found in a stolen truck on campus. Inside the truck police found a stolen scoped rifle, a stolen shotgun, body armor, knives, a machete, and six incendiary devices. Jasper also had maps to three local campuses, the University of Washington, South Seattle Community College and Seattle University, in addition to anti-government literature and documents about the Syrian and Brazilian revolutions. Jasper had posted a podcast a few days prior to his arrest that indicated Jasper had anti-government views and was planning something in the western United States in support of the Brazilian revolution.

properties.title: De Anza College
properties.description: De Anza College student Al DeGuzman planned a Columbine style school shooting at the school.

properties.title: Holland Woods Middle
properties.description: A 12-year-old, 13-year-old and two 14-year-olds, all boys, planned to outdo Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold at Columbine massacre. They planned to hold up a gun store and then attack the school. Once there, they planned to rape some of the girls and shoot as many as 154 targets which they had drawn up on a list. They had stolen a building plan from the custodian's office but they were all caught within a day of a classmate's report to an assistant principal.

properties.title: Fairleigh Dickinson Univ
properties.description: During an
at a student dance, a student was shot and wounded, three people were stabbed and three others suffered other injuries.

properties.title: Wauseon School Bus
properties.description: Karen A. Smith, a 12-year-old junior high school student, is stabbed to death on a school bus. The assailant, identified as 14-year-old Douglas Konrath, fled the school bus but was arrested when he returned to the scene and attacked a deputy.

properties.title: University High
properties.description: 17-year-old Kelvin De La Cruz stabbed 15-year-old Michael Nieves in the chest with a pocket knife at a school bus stop of the Main Campus at University High School. After he stabbed him, Cruz hid under the bus and attempted to change his clothes, but was apprehended and charged with first-degree murder. Nieves died two hours after being stabbed.

properties.title: Maharishi Univ
properties.description: Maharishi University of Management student Shuvender Sem fatally stabbed a fellow student, Levi Butler, after Sem had attacked another student earlier in the day.

properties.title: LSU
properties.description: Oscar B. Turner, a professor of agronomy, is murdered by an axe-wielding assailant on the campus of Louisiana State University.

properties.title: Pennsylvania State Univ
properties.description: 22-year-old graduate student Betsy Aardsma is stabbed to death in the Pattee Library at the Pennsylvania State University in State College, Pennsylvania. Her killer is never apprehended.

properties.title: Stanford Univ
properties.description: 19-year-old Arlis Perry was stabbed to death with an ice pick in Stanford Memorial Church on the grounds of Stanford University by an unknown assailant.

properties.title: Wagner College
properties.description: Gerald Melton stabbed 19-year-old Helen Surgan to death on the campus of Wagner College.

properties.title: Harvard Univ
properties.description: Sinedu Tadesse stabbed her roommate, 20-year-old Trang Phuong Ho, to death with a hunting knife inside a dormitory at Harvard University. Tadesse also attacked one of Ho's visiting friends, 26-year-old Thao Nguyen, severely injuring her as well. Tadesse then hanged herself.

properties.title: Gallaudet Univ
properties.description: 19-year-old Benjamin Varner, an RA in the same dorm, was found stabbed to death. An investigation led authorities to Joseph Mesa Jr., and Mesa was found guilty of first-degree murder.

properties.title: Virginia Tech
properties.description: Yang Xin, a 22-year-old graduate student from Beijing, China, was decapitated with a kitchen knife by fellow student Zhu Haiyang, in a cafe on the campus of Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University (Virginia Tech).

properties.title: Virginia Union Univ
properties.description: Early on the morning of April 28, two students at Virginia Union University were stabbed. Police say the suspect, whose name has not been released, is not a VUU student.

properties.title: Univ of California - LA
properties.description: A 20-year-old female student of a chemistry laboratory at the University of California, Los Angeles was stabbed multiple times, including having her throat slashed, during class. A teaching assistant stopped the bleeding and called for help. The victim was transported to the hospital and needed surgery but was expected to recover. Police arrested Damon Thompson after the attack.

properties.title: Binghamton Univ
properties.description: Richard T. Antoun, 77, a professor of anthropology and specialist in Islamic and Middle Eastern studies, is stabbed to death inside his office at Binghamton University. Police arrested 46-year-old graduate student Abdulsalam S. al-Zahrani after the stabbing and charged him with second-degree murder.

properties.title: Casper College
properties.description: Christopher Krumm fatally shot his father with a bow and arrow at Casper College; he stabbed one female professor near her home, and stabbed himself to death at the college.

properties.title: Lone Star College-CyFair
properties.description: Fourteen students were injured, two critically, during a stabbing attack at the campus of Lone Star College-CyFair. The assailant was subdued by three students, and then was apprehended. The suspect, Dylan Quick, a student, was charged with three counts of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon.

properties.title: Holy Name School
properties.description: 10-year-old Clarence Stevens, a third grade pupil at Holy Name School, was stabbed to death inside a storeroom at the school by 27-year-old Guy Willie Ponder.

properties.title: Harlem PS 119
properties.description: Nine-year-old Margaret Patton was attacked and killed at PS 119 in Harlem by two fellow students. One student held Patton's arms while the other stabbed her to death. Police later arrested 11-year-old Madeline Kirkland, who was charged with murder, and 13-year-old Eileen Foster, who was charged with juvenile delinquency

properties.title: Lewis-Champlin Elementary
properties.description: Teacher Josephine Keane, 45, is sexually assaulted and stabbed to death inside a storeroom at Lewis-Champlin elementary school in Chicago. Lee Arthur Hester, a 14-year-old student, is later convicted of the murder and sentenced to 55 years in prison.

properties.title: North Hopewell Winterstown Elementary
properties.description: William Stankewicz entered North Hopewell Winterstown Elementary School and brutally slashed two teachers and a principal with a machete. He then subsequently wounded several children in a kindergarten classroom before being subdued by a faculty member.

properties.title: Mountain View Elementary
properties.description: Four students were stabbed in the neck by 33-year-old Jason Pritchard at Mountain View Elementary School.

properties.title: Notre Dame Elementary
properties.description: William Michael Layne, the estranged husband of a teacher at Notre Dame Elementary School, stabbed a bystander on the street prior to entering the school. He then walked into his wife's fifth grade classroom where he shot and stabbed her. Layne later shot and killed himself after a stand-off with police at his home.

properties.title: Spring High
properties.description: On September 4, 2013, one student was killed and three others were wounded in a stabbing attack at Spring High School in Spring, Texas, United States. A 17-year-old student, identified as Luis Alonzo Alfaro, was arrested and charged for the murder. The stabbing raised issues of gang and racial tensions among the Spring High School community and local community leaders.

properties.title: Athens
properties.description: Student Ernest Powers fatally stabbed his teacher Elbert Wattanbarger when he attempted to whip him for throwing stones.

properties.title: Brownsville Jr. High
properties.description: 16-year-old Ettra Cimagha is stabbed to death by 16-year-old Thomas Celestine during a fight at Brownsville Junior High School.

properties.title: King William High
properties.description: 17-year-old Linwood Johnson Regensburg is stabbed to death by 20-year-old Robert Edward Lee at a dance held at King William High School. Neither Regensburg nor Lee were students at the school.

properties.title: Aledo High
properties.description: 26-year-old track coach George Marich was stabbed to death by 17-year-old student James Gipson in a hallway of Aledo High School. The stabbing occurred after Marich had removed Gipson and two other seniors from a study hall for creating a disturbance.

properties.title: Bronx High
properties.description: 18-year-old Henry Smith, a student at a Bronx vocational high school, is stabbed to death by 16-year-old Randolph Lawrence, a fellow student. The stabbing was reportedly sparked over a dispute about a basketball game.

properties.title: Wilbur Wright High
properties.description: Thomas Prinz, a 21-year-old football coach at Wilbur Wright High School, is stabbed to death by 19-year-old Will Edward Dixon. The stabbing occurred when Prinz attempted to escort Dixon off the playing field. Dixon had been a student at the school but had dropped out after tenth grade.

properties.title: RHAM High
properties.description: A 17-year-old girl is stabbed to death by a 15-year-old boy in a corridor of RHAM High School. The boy was arrested by police after being restrained by 50 other students.

properties.title: John Adams High
properties.description: Michael Kittrell, 15, is stabbed to death by another student at John Adams High School.

properties.title: Greenville High
properties.description: Henry Chiariello, a 30-year-old social studies teacher, is stabbed to death at Greenville High School by 18-year-old student Jewel Garrett.

properties.title: Edison Middle
properties.description: Francisco Walker, 24, a sixth-grade teacher at Edison Middle School, is stabbed to death when he attempted to chase a teenaged trespasser off of the school grounds. 15-year-old Steven Wayne Holmes is later arrested and charged with first degree murder.

properties.title: Jones High
properties.description: A 16-year-old girl fatally stabbed her classmate, 18-year-old Anthony Johnson, in the upper back with a hunting knife in a classroom at Jesse H. Jones High School, in Houston, Texas; Johnson later died at Ben Taub Hospital. The suspect was then placed in the Harris County Juvenile Probation Department. It was reported that the possible motive was the victim making an insulting comment about the suspect's clothing.

properties.title: East St. John High
properties.description: 19-year-old senior Debbie Morantes is stabbed to death by 16-year-old sophomore Brenda Carter inside the cafeteria of East St. John High School. Brenda Carter was convicted of second-degree murder two years later.

properties.title: Arlington High
properties.description: 17-year-old Bertram Bowman is stabbed to death in the cafeteria of Arlington High School, reportedly in a dispute over a girl. Police arrested 15-year-old Edward C. Ector after the attack.

properties.title: South Shore High
properties.description: Damion Ennis, 15, is stabbed to death by a fellow student in a hallway of South Shore High School.

properties.title: Jr High School 25
properties.description: 15-year-old Angel Jimenez is stabbed to death by another 15-year-old student in a hallway of Junior High School 25. The stabbing was sparked by a dispute between the two boys over who owned a pair of sunglasses.

properties.title: Mount Vernon High
properties.description: 17-year-old Shebule Jackson is stabbed to death by fellow student Hopeton Minott in a corridor of Mount Vernon High School.

properties.title: Jefferson Middle
properties.description: 13-year-old Stephne Givens was fatally stabbed at Jefferson Middle School by a fellow student.

properties.title: Deady Middle
properties.description: Estanislao Balderas, 14, stabbed a 13-year-old boy named Samuel Avila in the head with a screwdriver in a fight at Deady Middle School. Samuel Avila died. Balderas was arrested and prosecuted.

properties.title: Canarsie High
properties.description: 12-year-old Anthony Haynes is stabbed to death in the cafeteria of Canarsie High School. Two 16-year-old students were arrested for the crime. It was suspected that the stabbing was gang-related.

properties.title: Southwood Middle
properties.description: 14-year old Michael Hernandez stabbed and slit the throat of a 14-year-old classmate, Jaime Rodrigo Gough, while in a restroom at Southwood Middle School.

properties.title: Lincoln-Sudbury Regional High
properties.description: 15-year-old James Alenson was stabbed to death with a knife in the Lincoln-Sudbury Regional High School washroom in the East House section by 16-year old John Odgren. Odgren did not know Alenson, and he chose to stab him at random.

properties.title: Lemmel Middle
properties.description: 15-year-old Markel Williams was stabbed to death on the grounds of William H. Lemmel Middle School, during school hours. 14-year-old Timothy Oxendine was tried as an adult and was convicted of first-degree murder.

properties.title: Marina Middle
properties.description: A 14-year-old female student was struck eight times with a pair of scissors in a classroom at Marina Middle School, in San Francisco, California, by another 14-year-old female classmate. The victim suffered wounds to the head, arms, chest, and back and was treated at a local hospital.

properties.title: Coral Gables Sr. High
properties.description: Juan Carlos Rivera, a 17-year-old student of Coral Gables Senior High School, was stabbed in the chest by another student and died. The stabbing happened during a fight between the two students, reportedly over a girl. 17-year-old student Andy Rodriguez was arrested for the crime.

properties.title: John Tyler High
properties.description: 50-year-old Todd Henry, a special education teacher at John Tyler High School, was fatally stabbed by a student inside a classroom at the school. Henry later died of his injuries at a local hospital. The attacker was taken into custody.

properties.title: Carolina Forest High
properties.description: Trevor Varinecz, a junior at Carolina Forest High School, attacked and stabbed police officer Marcus Rhodes, the School Resource Officer, inside his office. Rhodes then shot Varinecz in self defense. Varinecz later died in hospital.

properties.title: Memphis Jr Academy
properties.description: Suzette York, 49, the principal of Memphis Junior Academy, was stabbed to death in a classroom by 16-year-old student Eduardo Marmolejo. Marmolejo was tried as an adult and charged with second-degree murder.

properties.title: South Gate High
properties.description: A 17-year-old girl, a senior, was stabbed in the side and back at South Gate High School, allegedly by her estranged boyfriend. She died from her injuries. Two other people who tried to intervene with the stabbing were also injured. The suspect, an 18-year-old student, was charged with murder.

properties.title: Snohomish High
properties.description: A 15-year-old student stabbed two female students with a butcher knife at Snohomish High School. One of the victims was stabbed 20 times, mainly in the heart and lungs, and was critically injured. The victims were both chosen at random, and the victims and suspect did not know each other. The attacker was convicted of attempted murder and was sentenced to 13 years in prison.

properties.title: Erasmus Hall High
properties.description: A student at Erasmus Hall High School was critically injured after being stabbed in the head repeatedly with a pair of scissors. A 16-year-old student was arrested and charged with attempted murder.

properties.title: AMIKids Infinity Charter
properties.description: 17-year-old Chris Wormerly was stabbed to death on the front steps of AMIKids Infinity Charter School. Another 17-year-old student was arrested. The suspect was charged as an adult with murder and attempted murder.

properties.title: Wilson Southern Middle
properties.description: A 14-year-old male student stabbed another 14-year-old male student four times with a pocketknife at Wilson Southern Middle School. The assailant was arrested after fleeing from the school.

properties.title: Agape Christian Academy
properties.description: A 16-year-old student was shot in the hip at Agape Christian Academy after a fight broke out at 2 pm. An innocent bystander was hit in his ankle by a stray bullet or shrapnel. The two victims were treated for non-life-threatening injuries. The suspected shooter reportedly fled in a car with several other males. He was not caught

properties.title: Lanier High
properties.description: A 17-year-old student fatally shot himself with a handgun in the courtyard of Lanier High School. The shooting happened in front of other students.

properties.title: North Carolina A&T State Univ
properties.description: A 21-year-old student was shot and wounded at North Carolina A&T State University. The victim was hospitalized for serious but non-life-threatening injuries. The university was temporarily locked down that night, and the lockdown was lifted about half an hour later. No suspects are in custody.

properties.title: Stephenson High
properties.description: A Stephenson High School student and a janitor were shot in an apparent confrontation between team members and a group of teens who don't attend the school. Both were innocent bystanders in the ordeal.

properties.title: Brashear High
properties.description: After classes ended, at least one gunman came out of the woods and opened fire on three students as they were walking to their cars at Brashear High School. One student was grazed in the head, another was struck in the neck and shoulder, and a third was hit in the leg and foot. Six people were taken into custody. The shooting is believed to be drug-related.

properties.title: South Dakota School of Mines & Tech
properties.description: A physics professor, Alberto Lemut, 37, at South Dakota School of Mines & Technology died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound at the Electrical Engineering/Physics building.

properties.title: West Orange High
properties.description: A 15-year-old student was shot and wounded by a 17-year-old student near a soccer field on the campus of West Orange High School. The shooting occurred after a fight broke out between the two students. The 17-year-old suspected shooter was taken into custody several miles away from the school.

properties.title: Arapahoe High
properties.description: 18-year-old Karl Pierson shot 17-year-old student Claire Davis in the head, fatally injuring her, in a hallway in Arapahoe High School. Pierson then committed suicide by shooting himself. Pierson was armed with a shotgun, three Molotov cocktails, and a machete. He was looking for a faculty member who had disciplined him, and intended to shoot him. Claire Davis died from her injuries on December 21, 2013

properties.title: Edison High
properties.description: Four teens went into Edison High School in what was believed as a gang-initiation process. After accosting a 62-year-old woman about a mile away from school grounds, they found an athletic trainer who taught at Edison High and shot him several times in the leg and stomach. It took a few days for the youths to get caught, and this was cinched when the 62-year-old woman and some surveillance video gave police the information they needed.

properties.title: Marysville-Pilchuck High School
properties.description: The Marysville Pilchuck High School shooting occurred in Marysville, Washington, on October 24, 2014, when 15-year-old freshman student Jaylen Fryberg shot five other students at Marysville Pilchuck High School, fatally wounding four, before fatally shooting himself.

properties.title: Florida State University 2014 Shooting
properties.description: On November 20, 2014, a gunman, identified as 31-year-old Myron May, shot an employee and two students at Strozier Library on the university campus shortly after midnight. He was a lawyer and an alumnus of the university, who was obsessed with targeted individual conspiracy theories and believed that the U.S. government was watching him. He was fatally shot by responding police officers after he shooting at them outside Strozier Library. After the shooting, it was revealed that May had mailed a total of ten packages to friends throughout the country beforehand; the contents of the packages are unknown.

properties.title: Apostolic Revival Center Christian School
properties.description: Shots were fired at Apostolic Revival Center Christian School, leaving 27-year-old Kristopher Smith dead in what was believed to be a retaliation killing, possibly for talking with police about a previous incident.

properties.title: Cesar Chavez High School
properties.description: An argument over turf and respect between two rival gangs escalated to what police now describe as a

in January at Cesar Chavez High School in Phoenix. Approximately fifteen shots were fired in the vicinity of people waiting to get into a scheduled boy's basketball game. Fortunately, no one was injured.

properties.title: Grambling State University
properties.description: Three students were shot and injured on the campus of

properties.title: Ossie Ware Mitchell Middle School
properties.description: Allegedly responding to a student fight, a parent brought and fired a weapon on the campus of Ossie Ware Mitchell Middle School. No one was injured.

properties.title: Alexander W. Dreyfoos School
properties.description: Two custodians at Alexander W. Dreyfoos School were shot and killed. The deceased were Christopher Marshall, 48, and his boss Ted Orama, 56. A third custodian was suspected in the killings and was apparently on the lam.

properties.title: North Panola High School
properties.description: A student, Roderick Bobo, 15, was shot during a football game at North Panola High School in what was termed as a gang-related shooting. Two others were injured in the shooting, and three men were charged as being responsible for the crime.

properties.title: Liberty University
properties.description: Liberty University freshman Joshua Hathaway was killed early Tuesday morning, Nov. 19 in an altercation with a Liberty University Emergency Services officer, the Lynchburg Police Department reported.

properties.title: Liberty Technology Magnet High School
properties.description: A student was charged with bringing a gun to school at Liberty Technology Magnet High School and shooting a classmate in the thigh. The incident occurred outside the front of the school.

properties.title: Hillhouse High School
properties.description: A 14-year-old boy was shot outside of a basketball game at the Hillhouse High School athletic facility, suffering wounds in his hand and leg.

properties.title: Berrendo Middle School
properties.description: Two people were shot and wounded inside the gymnasium of Berrendo Middle School, at about 8:10 am. An 11-year-old boy and a 13-year-old girl were airlifted to a hospital in

properties.title: Delaware Valley Charter High School
properties.description: A student allegedly shot two other students in the gymnasium at Delaware Valley Charter School. Both victims, a male and a female, were shot in the arm. They were taken to a nearby hospital and are in stable condition, police say. Police Commissioner Charles Ramsey said at a news conference that the shooter ran out of the school after the shooting but was taken into custody near his home. 17-year-old Raisheem Rochwell was arrested and charged as an adult for aggravated assault, recklessly endangering another person and firearms offenses.

properties.title: Widener University
properties.description: One person was shot and critically injured at

properties.title: Purdue University
properties.description: A 21-year-old student, Andrew Boldt, was shot and killed in a classroom building on the campus of

properties.title: South Carolina State University
properties.description: A 20-year-old student was shot and killed at

properties.title: Los Angeles Valley College
properties.description: A man was shot and killed at

properties.title: Rebound High School
properties.description: A group of students at Rebound High School got in an argument in the school's parking lot. One student pulled out a gun and shot another student in the ensuing altercation. An 18-year-old suspect is facing charges of attempted murder.

properties.title: Tennessee State University
properties.description: One student was shot in the leg in an apparent altercation over a gambling debt at

properties.title: President Theodore Roosevelt High School
properties.description: A 17-year-old boy was shot in the wrist after attacking police officers with a kitchen knife at

properties.title: Eastern Florida State College
properties.description: Three students were fighting in a parking lot of

properties.title: North High School
properties.description: After a basketball game at

properties.title: Bend High School
properties.description: Police say a Bend High School student died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound in the presence of classmates. The student brought the gun onto campus and fired the fatal shot Friday in a modular classroom. No one else was injured.

properties.title: Charles F. Brush High School
properties.description: Five shots were fired in the parking lot of

properties.title: Salisbury High School
properties.description: 17 year old suspect was charged with assault with a deadly weapon with intent to kill inflicting serious injury, possession of a firearm on school property and discharging a weapon on school property.

properties.title: Salisbury High School
properties.description: A 16-year-old student was shot in the stomach on the campus of

properties.title: University of Southern California
properties.description: A male victim was shot in the back in a possible gang-related drive-by shooting near the

properties.title: San Jose State University
properties.description: A man wielding a large knife was shot and killed by officers from the

properties.title: Georgia Regents University
properties.description: While responding to a noise complaint, a University police officer fired after a suspect attempted to hit him with a car while trying to leave. Suspect was later found in the woods nearby with non-life-threatening injuries, and charged with aggravated assault on an officer.

properties.title: The Academy of Knowledge Preschool
properties.description: An elementary school teacher was shot and killed outside The Academy of Knowledge Preschool by her husband in what authorities described as a domestic altercation. Suspect was caught later and charged with second-degree murder.

properties.title: Benjamin Banneker High School
properties.description: An argument between students led to shots being fired in a

properties.title: D. H. Conley High School
properties.description: Just after the lunch hour, at D. H. Conley High School, a car drove past the school and witnesses said an occupant reached out of a car window and fired shots in the direction of the school. This incident occurred on Worthington and Tull Roads, directly in front of the school. No one was injured. Two 17 year old students were arrested the next day after firing a handgun from a moving vehicle in the direction of the school. No students or teachers were injured.

properties.title: East English Village Preparatory Academy
properties.description: After a Friday evening student awards ceremony called
, four men who were affiliated with a gang fired into a crowd in the parking lot of

properties.title: Saint Mary School
properties.description: A man fatally shot his estranged wife in the parking lot of Saint Mary School in northwestern Indiana and later killed himself at his home after a police officer confronted him.

properties.title: Paine College
properties.description: Two men fired shots inside a dormitory at Paine College on Sunday, injuring one student in the head. Neither of the suspects were students at the college.

properties.title: Paine College
properties.description: An active shooter situation was reported at Paine College on Monday with one person reported to be shot. The suspect was apparently apprehended and in custody. It was the second shooting incident to occur at the college campus in two days.

properties.title: Georgia Gwinnett College
properties.description: A person was shot on a student parking lot roof at Georgia Gwinnett College, receiving an injury. The specific cause has not been identified.

properties.title: John F. Kennedy High School
properties.description: A 14-year-old student was injured during a drive-by shooting in front of

properties.title: University of California
properties.description: 2014 Isla Vista killings. 22-year-old Elliot Rodger went on a stabbing and shooting rampage just outside the main campus of the

properties.title: Seattle Pacific University
properties.description: Three people were shot inside a hallway in

properties.title: Reynolds High School
properties.description: At around 8:30 am, shots were fired at

properties.title: River Woods Elementary
properties.description: An 11-year-old student at RWES in Des Moines, Iowa, brought a BB gun to the school accompanied by two former students aged 11 & 16. The student admitted to having the weapon and making threats against 4 students. Police recovered the gun and arrested the alleged students.

properties.title: Indiana State University
properties.description: A 20-year-old Indiana State University (ISU) student was shot by another ISU on Saturday inside a residence hall. The injuries were not fatal, and a full recovery was expected. The shooter was arrested on the following day.

properties.title: Albemarle High School
properties.description: Two students got in an argument at

properties.title: Fern Creek Traditional High School
properties.description: One student was shot and injured at

properties.title: Langston Hughes High School
properties.description: After a homecoming football game, a fatal shooting of Kristofer Hunter, 17, occurred in the Langston Hughes High School parking lot. The assailant, Eric Dana Johnson Jr., 18, turned himself in a week later.

properties.title: Miami Carol City High School
properties.description: Two teens were shot Thursday during a fight on Miami Carol City High School property. One of the boys who was shot died.

properties.title: Rogers State University
properties.description: On December 5, 2014, 38-year-old Thomas Floyd Fees, a former Tulsa police officer, fired two gunshots the campus of

properties.title: Rosemary Anderson High School
properties.description: On December 12, 2014, an unknown gunman shot three students and a man outside Rosemary Anderson High School in north Portland. A 16-year-old girl was in critical condition, while the others suffered minor injuries. An 18 year-old man was arrested in connection with the shooting.

properties.title: Bloomington High School
properties.description: Andrew Lyons, 15, sent messages electronically at approximately 11:17 A.M., asking people to help him carry out a Columbine-style shooting at Bloomington High School, but was arrested by police at about 3:06 P.M. and was questioned and his person and home was searched for weapons and possible links to his statements. Nothing was found, and no charges were filed as of February 21. He also agreed to seek help at Streamwood Behavioral Healthcare for possible mental illness and was released on January 18. No shooting, injures, or deaths took place as a result of his statements.

properties.title: Wisconsin Lutheran High School
properties.description: A 15-year-old boy, a student

properties.title: Frederick High School
properties.description: Two students were shot outside Frederick High School near the gymnasium of

properties.title: University of South Carolina
properties.description: Sunghee Kwon, 42, committed suicide immediately after killing her ex-husband.

properties.title: Bethune-Cookman University
properties.description: Two students argued outside the music building at Bethune-Cookman University in Daytona Beach when one pulled out a gun. Both had guns and it is not disclosed who did the shooting, injuring three students. A reward was offered to help solve this case.

properties.title: Pershing Elementary School
properties.description: Police said one person has been arrested for a shooting at Pershing Elementary School in University City. The shooting occurred in the parking lot, with a 34-year-old-man being shot in the buttocks.

properties.title: J.B. Martin Middle School
properties.description: A police officer was shot outside a school in a school zone while he was directing school buses into a school. The school was J.B. Martin Middle School, and the suspect was apprehended at the scene.

properties.title: Wayne Community College
properties.description: One person was shot and killed in the school library of Wayne Community College of Goldsboro, North Carolina.

properties.title: Freedom High School
properties.description: 17-year-old former student of

properties.title: 2013 Alabama Bunker Hostage Crisis
properties.description: On January 29, 2013, a hostage crisis, lasting almost seven days, began in the Wiregrass Region near U.S. Highway 231 in Midland City, Alabama. Jimmy Lee Dykes, a 65-year-old Vietnam War-era veteran boarded a Dale County school bus, killed the driver, and took a five-year-old boy hostage. On the afternoon of Monday, February 4, law enforcement agents entered the bunker, killed Dykes, and rescued the child hostage.

properties.title: DeRenne Middle School
properties.description: A 13-year-old female student was stabbed by another female student at DeRenne Middle School. She was hospitalized for non-life-threatening injuries to the head, shoulder and right arm. The suspect was charged with aggravated assault, possession of a weapon on school property and disrupting public school.

properties.title: West Albany High School
properties.description: Grant Acord, a 17-year-old junior who was attending

properties.title: Ronald E. McNair Discovery Learning Academy
properties.description: A gunman with an AK-47 fired six shots inside the front office of Ronald E. McNair Discovery Learning Academy, an elementary school. After the gunman fired the shots, he barricaded himself in the office and police at the scene returned fire. Nobody was injured. The gunman surrendered in the office and was apprehended. Children had to leave the building and were being guided to a corner of a field, where they were picked up by their parents. The alleged gunman is a 20-year-old male named Michael Brandon Hill.

properties.title: Carver High School
properties.description: A 15-year-old student was shot in the neck and shoulder at

properties.title: Forsyth County Schools
properties.description: 51-year-old Joseph Medved was arrested for reportedly threatening to shoot up a school at a drug clinic. Police were contacted and followed Medved after he bought a shotgun at a local store. He was arrested when he took the gun home and started shooting.

properties.title: South Greene High School
properties.description: A 15-year-old student was stabbed and injured at

properties.title: Wire Village School

properties.title: Pinewood Elementary School
properties.description: A man with a knife hijacked a school bus in Jacksonville, taking 11 Pinewood Elementary School students and their bus driver on a detour that police ended in Cabot after a 10-mile chase. Police stopped the hijacking 20 minutes after it began. The suspect, 22-year-old Nicholas John Miller, was charged with a felony count of vehicle piracy, 12 felony counts of kidnapping, and two felony counts of aggravated assault.

properties.title: Parkway Academy Central
properties.description: A student was beaten on a school bus that was heading to students' homes from Parkway Academy Central. The beating was recorded and appeared on social media websites. Five students were charged with third-degree assault and third-degree conspiracy in connection with the attack. The victim did not suffer serious injuries.

properties.title: Waseca Junior/Senior High School
properties.description: 17-year-old John David LaDue was charged on May 1 with 10 attempted murder and explosives counts in a plot to shoot his family to death and then kill himself and

by blowing up Waseca Junior/Senior High School, according to authorities. Explosives and materials used to create explosives were found in his possession. LaDue reportedly idolized the Columbine High School massacre shooters.

properties.title: Los Banos Junior High School
properties.description: A 13-year-old student was stabbed and injured during a school fire drill for Los Banos Junior High School. A 14-year-old classmate was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder in connection with the incident. A folding knife was believed to be the weapon used. The victim was hospitalized for nearly one week for non-critical injuries.

properties.title: Friendship Academy of Science and Technology
properties.description: A 14-year-old student was stabbed in the chest at Friendship Academy of Science and Technology during an altercation with another student. A 17-year-old, Sharrod Alston, was charged with first and second-degree assault, disorderly conduct and possession with a deadly weapon.

properties.title: Lafayette Elementary School
properties.description: A 9-year-old girl was attacked with a hammer at Lafayette Elementary School. The girl was hospitalized for her injuries. A 39-year-old woman, who was a class volunteer at the school, was arrested at the scene and charged with assault with a deadly weapon.
